meanings.definition: A person who engages in filibustering.
meanings.sent1: The filibusterers talked for hours to delay the vote.
meanings.sent2: The group of filibusterers in the senate tried to block the new law.
meanings.sent3: The filibusterers joked that they could talk forever without getting tired.
meanings.sent4: The filibusterers were like human roadblocks, stopping progress in its tracks.
meanings.sent5: The image of the filibusterers speaking endlessly is hard to forget.

meanings.sent1: We saw two filibusterers arguing in the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The filibusterers' speeches were long and repetitive.
meanings.sent3: The room was filled with filibusterers, each trying to out-talk the other.
meanings.sent4: The filibusterers stood united, ready to talk until the end of time.
meanings.sent5: The crowd of filibusterers created a wall of words that no one could break through.
